title: "torch.mm received an invalid combination of arguments"
body_html:
I get this error:
`TypeError: torch.mm received an invalid combination of arguments - got (torch.FloatTensor, Variable), but expected one of:

  • (torch.SparseFloatTensor mat1, torch.FloatTensor mat2)
  • (torch.FloatTensor source, torch.FloatTensor mat2)
    `
    when matrix multiplying a raw Tensor with a Variable (which is a Tensor). Both are of type FloatTensor. I don't understand, I thought variables should do everything a tensor can do since it's just a thin wrapper.
body_text:
I get this error:
`TypeError: torch.mm received an invalid combination of arguments - got (torch.FloatTensor, Variable), but expected one of:

(torch.SparseFloatTensor mat1, torch.FloatTensor mat2)
(torch.FloatTensor source, torch.FloatTensor mat2)
`
when matrix multiplying a raw Tensor with a Variable (which is a Tensor). Both are of type FloatTensor. I don't understand, I thought variables should do everything a tensor can do since it's just a thin wrapper.
body:
I get this error:
`TypeError: torch.mm received an invalid combination of arguments - got (torch.FloatTensor, Variable), but expected one of:
 * (torch.SparseFloatTensor mat1, torch.FloatTensor mat2)
 * (torch.FloatTensor source, torch.FloatTensor mat2)
`
when matrix multiplying a raw Tensor with a Variable (which is a Tensor). Both are of type FloatTensor. I don't understand, I thought variables should do everything a tensor can do since it's just a thin wrapper.
